data.question: What are the two ultramicroporous metal-organic frameworks mentioned for their selectivity towards acetylene?
data.answer: NKMOF-1-M (M = Cu or Ni)

data.question: What is the significance of the binding site I in NKMOF-1-M for acetylene adsorption?
data.answer: Binding site I combines hydrogen bonding and pi-pi interactions between C2H2 and the pyrazine units in NKMOF-1-M, leading to strong acetylene-sorbent interactions.

data.question: How does the adsorption selectivity of NKMOF-1-Ni for C2H2/CO2 (1/1, v/v) compare to the current benchmark material?
data.answer: The adsorption selectivity of NKMOF-1-Ni for C2H2/CO2 (1/1, v/v) is more than an order of magnitude better than the current benchmark, DICRO-4-Ni-i.

data.question: What experimental method was used to determine the binding sites of C2H2 in NKMOF-1-Cu?
data.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) was used to determine the binding sites of C2H2 in NKMOF-1-Cu.

data.question: Based on the text, what is the primary focus of further study for NKMOF-1-M due to its properties?
data.answer: The primary focus of further study for NKMOF-1-M is NKMOF-1-Ni due to its higher thermal stability, convenient activation conditions, and higher BET surface area compared to NKMOF-1-Cu.

data.question: What role does the pyrazine-2,3-dithiol (pdt) play in the structure of NKMOF-1-M?
data.answer: Pyrazine-2,3-dithiol (pdt) acts as a linker in the structure of NKMOF-1-M, connecting Cu or Ni ions to form the 3D framework with one-dimensional square channels.

data.question: True or False: NKMOF-1-Ni exhibits the highest selectivity for C2H2/CH4 separation compared to all other materials mentioned.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: The performance of NKMOF-1-M is driven by the same mechanism as current benchmark physisorbents.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: NKMOF-1-M materials are unstable in water.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the BET surface area of NKMOF-1-Ni after activation under vacuum at 90 88C?
What is the role of open metal sites in the performance of NKMOF-1-M?
data.answer: Open metal sites in NKMOF-1-M contribute to strong interactions between C2H2 and pore walls, enhancing C2H2 capture.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption selectivity of NKMOF-1-Ni for C2H2/CO2 (2/1, v/v) is less than TIFSIX-2-Cu-i.
data.answer: False

data.question: What experimental technique was used to verify the hydrolytic stability of NKMOF-1-M?
data.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and surface area measurements were used to verify the hydrolytic stability of NKMOF-1-M.

data.question: True or False: NKMOF-1-Ni can be recycled without loss of performance.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the Qst values for NKMOF-1-Ni?
data.answer: The Qst values for NKMOF-1-Ni indicate the binding affinity of the material towards different gases, with higher values suggesting stronger interactions and potential for selective gas capture.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption selectivity of NKMOF-1-Ni for C2H2/CH4 (1/1, v/v) is lower than ZJU-198 a.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of functional groups on the pore walls of MOFs in enhancing C2H2 capture?
data.answer: Functional groups on the pore walls of MOFs can afford strong sorbent-sorbate interactions, enhancing C2H2 capture.

data.question: True or False: The performance of NKMOF-1-M in gas separation is attributed solely to its ultra-high surface area.
data.answer: False

data.question: What experimental evidence supports the high binding affinity of NKMOF-1-Ni towards C2H2?
data.answer: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR) of NKMOF-1-Ni demonstrated the characteristic stretching vibration of C2H2, validating its high binding affinity towards C2H2.

data.question: How does the thermal stability of NKMOF-1-Ni compare to NKMOF-1-Cu?
data.answer: NKMOF-1-Ni exhibits thermal stability to 240 88C, whereas NKMOF-1-Cu loses crystallinity above 60 88C.
